title: Mass Generation, Ghost Condensation and Broken Symmetry: SU(2) in Covariant Abelian Gauges
abstract: The local action of an SU(2) gauge theory in general covariant Abelian gauges and the associated equivariant BRST symmetry that guarantees the perturbative renormalizability of the model are given. A global SL(2,R) symmetry of the model is spontaneously broken by ghost-antighost condensation at arbitrarily small coupling. This leads to propagators that are finite at Euclidean momenta for all elementary fields except the Abelian ``photon''. Ward Identities show that the symmetry breaking gives rise to massless BRST-quartets with ghost numbers (1,2,-2,-1) and (0,1,-1,0). The latter quartet is interpreted as due to an Abelian Higgs mechanism in the dual description of the model.
